Package CCDD

Class CcddSchedulerHandler

java.lang.Object
CCDD.CcddSchedulerHandler
public class CcddSchedulerHandler extends Object
CFS Command and Data Dictionary scheduler handler class

    • addVariableToMessage

      private List<String> addVariableToMessage(List<CcddClassesDataTable.Variable> variables, Integer[] messageIndices, int parentIndex)
      Add one or more variables to the specified message
      Parameters:
      variables - List of variables to be added
      messageIndices - (sub-)message indices to which the variable will be added
      parentIndex - Parent message index if this is a sub-message; -1 if this is not a sub-message
      Returns:
      List containing the names of the variables added

    • updateAfterVariableAdded

      private void updateAfterVariableAdded()
      Update actions required after adding one or more variables to a message. This is a separate method so that these update steps can be performed s single time if multiple variable additions are made

    • parseOption

      private Object[] parseOption(String option)
      Parse an option string to extract the message indices and, if a sub-message, the sub-message index
      Parameters:
      option - String representing the option in the format Message[s] #[, # [, ...]][ sub-msg[s] #[, # [, ...]]]
      Returns:
      Two-element object array. If the option string does not contains only a message name or names then the first element is -1 (indicating no sub-messages) and the second element is the array containing the message index (or indices) corresponding to the message name(s). If the option string contains one or more sub-message indices then the first element is the parent message index and the second element is the array containing the sub-message index (or indices). A null array is returned if the option provided is invalid

    • getMessageIndexByName

      private int getMessageIndexByName(String msgName)
      Get the index of the specified message
      Parameters:
      msgName - Message name
      Returns:
      Message index; -1 if the no message of the specified name exists

    • getMessageWithRoom

      private String getMessageWithRoom(Float rate, int totalSize)
      Find the message option that has the largest message with the least amount of room
      Parameters:
      rate - Rate of the options
      totalSize - Size of the variable(s) in bytes
      Returns:
      Message into which the specified bytes can fit; null if no option is chosen

    • getTelemetryOptions

      protected void getTelemetryOptions()
      Update the options list with all possible options for the selected variable at the currently selected rate

      private int getSmallestByteSize(Integer[] indices, int parentIndex)
      Get the smallest byte count for a list of (sub-)messages
      Parameters:
      indices - (sub-)message indices
      parentIndex - Parent message index if this is a sub-message; -1 if this is not a sub-message
      Returns:
      Smallest number of bytes

      private JPanel createArrowButtonPanel()

      Returns:

      protected void setArrowsEnabled(boolean enable)
      Enable/disable the dialog arrow buttons
      Parameters:
      enable - True to enable the arrows, false to disable

    • checkSlotAvailability

      private boolean checkSlotAvailability(Integer[] indices, int numOfVars)
      Check if a message has a remaining slot available for the variables. If this is not for the application scheduler then always return true
      Parameters:
      indices - Array of subMessge indices
      numOfVars - Number of variables being added
      Returns:
      True if there is room for the variable(s); false if there is insufficient room
